column1: Combined High Blood Cholesterol and Triglyceride Level
column2: minnie855, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Livalo for 10 months, after2 weeks, i started getting  intense leg cramps & toe cramps. Reported this to my doctor and he cut my doseage to 2g from 4g.my next blood test showed quite an improvement.  my trigliserides went down tofrom 500 to 250. But I told him that I didnt want to take Livalo anymore  because I just wanted to get my trigliserides down and thenquit them as I was having too many strangethings happening to me.  but I was determined to try to get my Tri down.  But I still had to get down some more.  so heput me on 1g per day. I still get the painful leg and toe cramping,the cramping lasted too long, then leaving my muscles sore the next day. and now I have what looks like tiny red spots on top of my feet and toes. Looks like Petechia. and also beenhaving dreams at night that are so vivid and seem so real. this was scary. Also couldnot focus on anything, and my attention span was getting less and less. My hair is falling out and I wearing wigs now.  I am due for another test soon, and I am going to stop taking the Livalo no matter what.  I havent felt good for 10 months.  Even though Livalo was very effective in lowering my TRI.  It is not worth it to me.  I rather diet for the restof my life than to continue taking these pills.

column9: My numbers aren't to bad however I did suffer a heart attack 2  months ago and the doc put me on this med.I have previously taken 3 other statins that gave me all the symptoms I am reading here. Not sure if Livalo is the answer as I am having some muscle pain and severe fatigue. I felt much better when they took me off the beta blockers but now feel tired all the time. This morning my shoulders were aching and lower back was sore   this is new so will wait and see. I doubt there is a statin out there that is 100% free of side effects but sure would like one with minimal effects. Otherwise will have to resort to whatever else is available.

column9: A few months after my last review i have developed an almost unbearable pain in my right arm right up by the tricep. It is intensified when i sleep on my right side and arm. I generally keep two advils by my bedside which generally alleviates the pain within 30 minutes.In response to this, i have cut down my dosage to 2 mg every other day. However, it doesnt seem to have an effect on the pain. Plus, i still experience weakness in my right arm. Funny because it never affects my left arm.I really dont want to quit taking this medication. column1: High Cholesterol
column2: Kristie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took it for one month. In about a couple weeks I started noticed sensations of coldness on my feet, as if the air conditioning were blowing directly on my feet. I also began to have trouble climbing stairs. Then I begin to feel sore sitting in a chair. I began to sleep in mornings. Finally one night, the coldness had traveled up my legs to me knees even though I had sweat pants on and it was warm inside, but legs were freezing! I quit the Livalo that night. the next day I woke up feeling bad, but decided to go to the gym and walk on the treadmill for 20 minutes. I came home, ate breakfast, and then suddenly got achey all over like I had run and marathon. I took some ibuprofen and went to bed. I called my dr. but she said to call her back in a couple days if I didn't get better. Since then, I have been having symptoms of low back pain, , intermittent aching down the back of my legs, and trouble sitting for more than 20 minutes. One doctor said it was herniated disks, so I spent several months in physical therapy. But when I wasn't getting better I saw a neurosurgeon who looked at my MRI films which showed my disks were not touching my nerves. I am now at square one, and will be seeing a rheumatologist to rule out other diseases. I am 47 and was very active, going to the gym 5x a week. It has been nearly a year, and I am still having a little soreness in my back and legs, but it seems to be improving with time. I think this drug is very scary. People need to be aware at the sign of first symptoms to quit right away!

column1: Combined High Blood Cholesterol and Triglyceride Level
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ok last time i updated was on 11/1/11. I had just started Livalo and now nearly 3 months later want to give a honest update since i have had my blood work completed.Originally i complained of muscle pain at week 4. My doctor suggested dropping the dose down to 2 mg(from 4mg). It made the difference. No more muscle pain. The fatigue has subsided also. I blame a lot of the fatigue on the high dose of a beta blocker i was taking for hypertension. We switched to a new one which probably has played a large role in my new energy.As far as results, all i can say is the Livalo has been absolutely amazing. My Total cholesterol dropped from 260 to 156 and this is only with a slight diet change. I have basically replaced large breakfasts with a bowl of cereal or a Slimfast. There have been dramatic drops in my LDL also. However, my HDL only went up about 5 points so it was not as dramatic a shift.All in all, i am estatic over the numbers. For me, its the only statin i can tolerate and has given me remarkable changes.

column9: I began taking 2mg daily along with 200mg of CoQ10 at night in addition to Welchol 3.75g in the morning for high cholestrol about 6 months ago. Since both of these medications are absorbed in the stomach I was hoping for fewer side effects. Everything was fine for the first 3 months then after getting blood work done my doctor wanted to increase Livalo to 4mg since my LDL 134 was still high. Less than a week later I started experiencing severe  pain/cramps/numbness in my feet where I had problems walking and sleeping, I also noticed sharp pains in my back, neck and pelvis, all of which were symptoms that I was trying to avoid after years trying every other statin drug on the market with no luck.I was not advised to take vitiman D prior to beginning this medication like many have posted so I cant say if that may have helped, but in the mean time I'm cutting my 4mg in half and will try taking it every other day instead,unless my doctor advises me to stop.

column9: In may of 2009 my triglycerides was 326 and colesterol total was 279. My hdl choleterol 38 and ldl 176 all bad. Start taking fenofbrate 160 mg and it helped some, but when I added Livalo 2mg. 7 months ago It all changed to good. cholesterol total 181 hdl was 54.triglycerides was now 122. ldl cholesterol 103.Great change. but I can tell to not increase Livalo more than 2 mg.I had no pain with the combination but It seems like I have lost some muscle.I go to the DR. in 3 weeks to make sure its o.k. to stay on the large dose of fenofbrate of 160 mg.

column1: Combined High Blood Cholesterol and Triglyceride Level
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my third statin to try. The first was pravastatin which was horrible. Within one week i could barely get out of bed. I was so weak and my arms and shoulders ached nonstop. My doctor quit it and put me on Welchol. For the cost and trouble of taking it(6 large tabs a day which caused severe constipation) it did not lower my cholesterol a great deal(only about 20 points)I am now trying Livalo at the recommendation of a new doctor. I take 4 mg daily. For the first 3 weeks i was ecstatic. No side effects at all. On week 4 however i am starting to notice some troubling problems. The most severe is fatigue. So bad i struggle to stay awake through the day. I have weakness in my arms but not as severe as the pravastatin. I have also noticed more hair loss than normal.At this point i can't tell you if i will continue the medicine. My total cholesterol was 260 so i will go in for a lipid profile soon to see if its lower. For the cost of the drug, i am hoping to see remarkable results. I can say, despite the problems, it has been the easiest one for me to tolerate so far.

column1: High Cholesterol
column2: BillyB_45, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm quadriplegic, C-2 level for 20+ years now, recently started experiencing chest palpitations and shortness of breath. So I had my blood checked and my cholesterol levels (bad stuff) was extremely high, so my Dr put me on Lipitor. It caused me to cramp in my legs and my joints killed me, so much that even my Fentanyl patch for my daily pain didn't touch it!I went back to see my Dr about this so he put me on Livalo 2mg daily and almost within days, no more leg & back cramps or pain and after 4 months, my chest & breathing is really great, no more palpitations or shortness of breath. I go back in two weeks to see how it's working on lowering the LDL levels and will post the results, but I'm sure it's doing something good with hardly any unbearable side effects, unlike Lipitor!

column1: High Cholesterol
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a returning reviewer. I was on Livola for 7 weeks with seemingly no side effects. I stopped taking it a while ago.  It just happened that for most of the seven weeks I was on Livalo, I had stopped going to the gym. When I restarted, I was horrified by the condition I was in. I could hardly run. Never felt like this my entire life. I have had longer lapses in my exercise regimen and never experienced such outcome. Let me be clear. Livalo works! It lowered my LDL substantially. However, the loss of muscle coordination I experienced was enough to make me stop. If you are on Livalo, it may be a good idea to keep an active life style and pay attention to changes in muscle condition/coordination during moderate activity. I don't have any other risk factors than high LDL. Perhaps it's an easy decision for me to stop. If you have multiple risk factors, consult your physician before stopping your medication. As for me, I will take a less evasive route to keeping healthy.
